purl stitch backward loop cast on pick up and knit stitches italian tubular bind off yarn over knit two stitches together abbreviations co cast on ws wrong purl side rs right stockinette side bog beginning of round k1 knit one stitch p1 purl one stitch yo yarn over k2tog knit two together instructions the balaclava is knitted from the top down this means that you will first knitt a rectangle that covers the top of your head then you cast on stitches on the sides of the rectangle and knit the main part of the balaclava which covers the sides and back of you head once you have reached the jaw you cast on stitches with the backwards loop cast on method and knit the neck in the round lastly you will pick up stitches around the face opening and knit the ribbing top cast on 19 22 stitches on 5 mm us 8 / 60 cm 24 inches circular needles the first row is a ws purl row the second row is a rs stockinette row repeat row 1 and 2 until the piece measures 9 10 cm from the co edge and end with a ws row you have knitted 23 25 row put the stitches on hold and break the yarn with the rs facing up pick up and knit 15 17 stitches 2 stitches for every 3 row along the right side starting from the co edge work across the resting stitches in a stockinette stitch then pick up and knit 15 17 stitches along the left side 2 stitches for every 3 row now you have 49 56 stitches on the needles turn your work around and purl the next row then knit the next row in stockinette repeat row 1 and 2 until the work measures 20 21 cm from where the stitches were picked up end with a rs row neck ribbing cast on 19 22 stitches with the backward loop method at the end of the row join in the round and place a marker at the bog now you have 68 78 stitches you might have to switch to shorter circular needles knit 5 cm stockinette in the round switch to 4 5 mm needles and work k1 p1 for
